abstract.p: World Cup soccer qualifying results noted (S)

block.p: In other qualifying games in the region, which will be represented by three countries in the 2002 World Cup in Japan and South Korea, Barbados and Trinidad & Tobago sent strong signals with shocking victories over Costa Rica and Canada.

Barbados, which visits the United States Aug. 16, rallied for a 2-1 victory over visiting Costa Rica in Bridgetown, while T&T posted a 2-0 triumph over Canada in Edmonton, Alberta. The Canadians concentrated on the Manchester United striker Dwight Yorke and that left Angus Eve open for the first goal before Yorke sealed the victory.

In other qualifying games in the region, which will be represented by three countries in the 2002 World Cup in Japan and South Korea, Barbados and Trinidad & Tobago sent strong signals with shocking victories over Costa Rica and Canada.

Barbados, which visits the United States Aug. 16, rallied for a 2-1 victory over visiting Costa Rica in Bridgetown, while T&T posted a 2-0 triumph over Canada in Edmonton, Alberta. The Canadians concentrated on the Manchester United striker Dwight Yorke and that left Angus Eve open for the first goal before Yorke sealed the victory.

Mexico, considered the strongest in the region, barely overcame Panama by 1-0 on a goal by Miguel Zepeda with two minutes left. Panama dominated the first half and had two excellent chances to go ahead, but Percival Piggott missed the Mexican target both times.
